channel.title: Mouse Movement Detection Routines
channel.description:
Well to date my bots have all used my own take off of the SCAR's mouse movement procedure. (Of course :-p I helped with scar ALOOOT back in the day).
Anyways, it has come to my knowledge that scar's mousemovement procedure never fires a short-short detection packet as a normal plays mouse would.... This has hindered my bot project as I've been away from the macro-script community for too long... I've made some variances to scar's procedure for the mean time, but this will not hold me through...
Does anyone have any idea on where we shoudl start for mouse movement functions.
(I've been expirementing with tweens and using cosine and tangent to generate a smooth complexion but it still seems way too fake).

item.title: Mouse Movement Detection Routines
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

Yep, anyways, semaphores routine he gave richyT wasnt a complete routine.

Or have you already forgotten that him and I were partners for the longest time?

Nah, I haven't forgotten.
I wasn't sure if it was the complete routine or not. Either way, it was very sexy.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Movement Detection Routines
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Pwnd:

[quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=324.msg3414#msg3414 date=1142310875]
Have you looked at benland100's bezier spline mouse procedures? they are pretty nice looking and he wrote them for SCAR and for JAVA, lemme scour my harddrive and Ill try to find them and post them up here

They too don't look as I would move my mouse. Ask Semaphore for the mousemovement he gave RichyT. It looked nice. Sometimes it looked bad, but it was way random.[/quote]

I bet it was just bezier splines with some random parameters sent in

edit: just found ben's java file and attached it, it basically makes a path for your mouse to follow and returns it as an array, im sure youll figure it out

Read full topic
